controllers.factory.legacy_factory¶

Source: src\controllers\factory\legacy_factory.py

Module Overview¶

Controller factory with Pydantic v2 config alignment and robust error handling.

Complete Source Code¶

  46    pass

  49    """Raised when unexpected/unknown keys appear in a controller config block."""
  50    pass

 168# ---------- DRY import helper ----------
 169def _try_import(primary_mod: str, fallback_mod: str, attr: str) -> Any:
 170    """Try importing ``attr`` from ``primary_mod`` then ``fallback_mod``."""
 171    try:
 172        mod = __import__(primary_mod, fromlist=[attr])
 173        return getattr(mod, attr)
 174    except Exception:
 175        try:
 176            mod = __import__(fallback_mod, fromlist=[attr])
 177            return getattr(mod, attr)
 178        except Exception as e:
 179            raise ImportError(
 180                f"Could not import {attr} from either '{primary_mod}' or '{fallback_mod}': {e!s}"
 181            )
 182
 183# ---- tolerant imports (controllers) ----
 184ClassicalSMC = _try_import("src.controllers.smc.classic_smc", "controllers.smc.classic_smc", "ClassicalSMC")
 185SuperTwistingSMC = _try_import("src.controllers.smc.sta_smc", "controllers.smc.sta_smc", "SuperTwistingSMC")
 186AdaptiveSMC = _try_import("src.controllers.smc.adaptive_smc", "controllers.smc.adaptive_smc", "AdaptiveSMC")
 187SwingUpSMC = _try_import("src.controllers.specialized.swing_up_smc", "controllers.specialized.swing_up_smc", "SwingUpSMC")
 188MPCController = _try_import("src.controllers.mpc.mpc_controller", "controllers.mpc.mpc_controller", "MPCController")
 189MPCWeights = _try_import("src.controllers.mpc.mpc_controller", "controllers.mpc.mpc_controller", "MPCWeights")

 192)

 203# ---- utilities ----
 204try:
 205    from src.utils import set_global_seed
 206except ImportError:
 207    def set_global_seed(seed: int) -> None:
 208        """Fallback when seed utility is unavailable."""
 209        import random
 210        import numpy as np
 211        random.seed(seed)
 212        np.random.seed(seed)
 213        logger.debug(f"Set global seed to {seed}")

 215# ---------- Normalization Functions ----------
 216def normalize_controller_name(name: str) -> str:
 217    """
 218    Normalize controller name and apply aliases.
 219    
 220    Lowercase, trim, replace hyphens/spaces/dots with underscores,
 221    then check alias map.
 222    """
 223    if not name:
 224        return ""
 225    
 226    # Basic normalization
 227    normalized = name.lower().strip()
 228    for char in ["-", " ", "."]:
 229        normalized = normalized.replace(char, "_")
 230    
 231    # Apply alias mapping
 232    canonical = ALIAS_MAP.get(normalized, normalized)
 233    
 234    if normalized != canonical:
 235        logger.debug(f"Controller name '{name}' normalized to '{canonical}' via alias")
 236    elif name != normalized:
 237        logger.debug(f"Controller name '{name}' normalized to '{normalized}'")
 238    
 239    return canonical
 240
 241def normalize_param_key(key: str) -> str:
 242    """Normalize parameter key: lowercase, replace hyphens/spaces with underscores."""
 243    if not key:
 244        return ""
 245    # Special case: preserve capitalization for K_ parameters
 246    if key.startswith('K_'):
 247        normalized = key.strip()
 248        for char in ["-", " "]:
 249            normalized = normalized.replace(char, "_")
 250        return normalized
 251    normalized = key.lower().strip()
 252    for char in ["-", " "]:
 253        normalized = normalized.replace(char, "_")
 254    return normalized
 255
 256def apply_deprecation_mapping(
 257    controller_name: str, 
 258    params: Dict[str, Any], 
 259    allow_unknown: bool = False
 260) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 261    """
 262    Apply deprecation mapping for a controller's parameters.
 263    
 264    Returns normalized params dict with deprecated keys mapped to current ones.
 265    Emits DeprecationWarning for each deprecated key found.
 266    """
 267    deprecation_map = DEPRECATED_PARAM_MAP.get(controller_name, {})
 268    normalized_params = {}
 269
 270    # Track which normalized keys we've seen to detect collisions
 271    seen_normalized = {}
 272    
 273    for original_key, value in params.items():
 274        # First normalize the key
 275        norm_key = normalize_param_key(original_key)
 276        
 277        # Check for deprecation (use original key for deprecation lookup)
 278        if original_key in deprecation_map:
 279            new_key = deprecation_map[original_key]
 280            # Only apply deprecation if the new key isn't already set
 281            if new_key not in params and new_key not in normalized_params:
 282                warnings.warn(
 283                    f"Parameter '{original_key}' is deprecated for {controller_name}. "
 284                    f"Please use '{new_key}' instead.",
 285                    DeprecationWarning,
 286                    stacklevel=3
 287                )
 288                logger.debug(f"Mapped deprecated param '{original_key}' -> '{new_key}' for {controller_name}")
 289                norm_key = new_key
 290            else:
 291                # New key already set, skip the deprecated one
 292                logger.debug(f"Skipping deprecated param '{original_key}' as '{new_key}' is already set")
 293                continue
 294        # Also check normalized form in deprecation map
 295        elif norm_key in deprecation_map:
 296            new_key = deprecation_map[norm_key]
 297            if new_key not in params and new_key not in normalized_params:
 298                warnings.warn(
 299                    f"Parameter '{original_key}' (normalized: '{norm_key}') is deprecated for {controller_name}. "
 300                    f"Please use '{new_key}' instead.",
 301                    DeprecationWarning,
 302                    stacklevel=3
 303                )
 304                logger.debug(f"Mapped deprecated param '{norm_key}' -> '{new_key}' for {controller_name}")
 305                norm_key = new_key
 306            else:
 307                continue
 308        
 309        # Check for key collision after normalization
 310        if norm_key in seen_normalized and seen_normalized[norm_key] != original_key:
 311            raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 312                f"controllers.{controller_name}: Parameter keys '{seen_normalized[norm_key]}' "
 313                f"and '{original_key}' both normalize to '{norm_key}'"
 314            )
 315        
 316        seen_normalized[norm_key] = original_key
 317        normalized_params[norm_key] = value
 318    
 319    return normalized_params
 320
 321def redact_value(value: Any) -> str:
 322    """Redact sensitive values for logging."""
 323    if value is None:
 324        return "None"
 325    value_str = str(value).lower()
 326    if any(keyword in value_str for keyword in ["password", "secret", "token", "key", "api"]):
 327        return "***"
 328    # Also redact if the key name suggests sensitivity
 329    return str(value)[:50] + "..." if len(str(value)) > 50 else str(value)
 330
 331# ---------- Registry Functions ----------
 332def register_controller(name: str) -> Callable[[Type[Any]], Type[Any]]:
 333    """
 334    Decorator for registering controller constructors.
 335    
 336    Registration is idempotent - re-registering the same name overwrites.
 337    """
 338    def decorator(cls: Type[Any]) -> Type[Any]:
 339        normalized_name = normalize_controller_name(name)
 340        with CONTROLLER_REGISTRY_LOCK:
 341            CONTROLLER_REGISTRY[normalized_name] = cls
 342            logger.info(f"Registered controller '{normalized_name}' -> {cls.__name__}")
 343        return cls
 344    return decorator
 345
 346# ---------- Helper Functions ----------
 347def _as_dict(obj: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 348    """Robustly convert an arbitrary object into a plain dict."""
 349    if obj is None:
 350        return {}
 351    if isinstance(obj, dict):
 352        return obj
 353    if hasattr(obj, "model_dump"):
 354        try:
 355            return obj.model_dump(exclude_unset=True)
 356        except Exception as e:
 357            logger.debug(f"Config conversion via model_dump() failed: {e}")
 358            pass  # OK: Try next conversion method
 359    if hasattr(obj, "dict"):
 360        try:
 361            return obj.dict(exclude_unset=True)
 362        except Exception as e:
 363            logger.debug(f"Config conversion via dict() failed: {e}")
 364            pass  # OK: Try next conversion method
 365    if hasattr(obj, "__dict__"):
 366        return dict(obj.__dict__)
 367    try:
 368        return dict(obj)
 369    except Exception as e:
 370        logger.debug(f"Config conversion via dict(obj) failed: {e}")
 371        return {}  # OK: Return empty dict as final fallback
 372
 373def _get_default_gains(controller_name: str, config: Any, gains_override: Optional[List[float]]) -> List[float]:
 374    """Get gains from override, defaults, or raise error."""
 375    if gains_override is not None:
 376        return list(gains_override)
 377    
 378    try:
 379        defaults_all = _as_dict(getattr(config, "controller_defaults", {}))
 380        defaults = defaults_all.get(controller_name, None)
 381        if isinstance(defaults, dict) and "gains" in defaults:
 382            return list(defaults["gains"])
 383        if hasattr(defaults, "gains"):
 384            return list(defaults.gains)
 385    except Exception as e:
 386        logger.debug(f"Could not extract default gains for {controller_name}: {e}")
 387        pass  # OK: Will raise FactoryConfigurationError below if no gains found
 388    
 389    raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 390        f"controllers.{controller_name}.gains: No gains provided and no defaults found. "
 391        f"Please specify 'controller_defaults.{controller_name}.gains' in config or pass gains explicitly."
 392    )
 393
 394def _ensure_dynamics_available(use_full: bool) -> None:
 395    """Ensure required dynamics model is available."""
 396    if use_full and FullDIPDynamics is None:
 397        raise ImportError(
 398            "FullDIPDynamics is unavailable. Ensure 'src/core/dynamics_full.py' is importable."
 399        )
 400    if (not use_full) and DoubleInvertedPendulum is None:
 401        raise ImportError(
 402            "DoubleInvertedPendulum is unavailable. Ensure 'src/core/dynamics.py' is importable."
 403        )
 404
 405def _validate_shared_params(controller_name: str, dt: float, max_force: float) -> None:
 406    """Validate common parameters shared by controllers."""
 407    if not (isinstance(dt, numbers.Real) and math.isfinite(float(dt)) and dt > 0):
 408        raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{controller_name}.dt must be > 0 (got {dt})")
 409    if not (isinstance(max_force, numbers.Real) and math.isfinite(float(max_force)) and max_force > 0):
 410        raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{controller_name}.max_force must be finite and > 0 (got {max_force})")
 411
 412# ---------- Main Factory Functions ----------
 413def build_controller(
 414    name: str,
 415    cfg: Union[Dict[str, Any], Mapping[str, Any], Any],
 416    *,
 417    allow_unknown: bool = False,
 418    config: Optional[Any] = None,  # For backward compat with create_controller
 419    gains: Optional[List[float]] = None
 420) -> Any:
 421    """
 422    Build a single controller from configuration.
 423    
 424    Parameters
 425    ----------
 426    name : str
 427        Controller name (will be normalized and aliased).
 428    cfg : dict or Mapping or ControllerConfig
 429        Controller-specific configuration.
 430    allow_unknown : bool
 431        If True, unknown parameters are stored as unknown_params on the instance.
 432        If False, unknown parameters raise FactoryConfigurationError.
 433    config : optional
 434        Full configuration object (for backward compatibility).
 435    gains : optional
 436        Explicit gains override.
 437    
 438    Returns
 439    -------
 440    Controller instance
 441    
 442    Raises
 443    ------
 444    FactoryConfigurationError
 445        If controller name is unknown or configuration is invalid.
 446    """
 447    # Normalize controller name
 448    controller_name = normalize_controller_name(name)
 449    
 450    # Check registry first
 451    with CONTROLLER_REGISTRY_LOCK:
 452        if controller_name in CONTROLLER_REGISTRY:
 453            controller_class = CONTROLLER_REGISTRY[controller_name]
 454            logger.info(f"Building controller '{controller_name}' from registry")
 455            
 456            # Convert config to dict
 457            cfg_dict = _as_dict(cfg)
 458            
 459            # Apply normalization and deprecation
 460            normalized_cfg = apply_deprecation_mapping(controller_name, cfg_dict, allow_unknown)
 461            
 462            # Handle gains
 463            if gains is not None:
 464                normalized_cfg["gains"] = gains
 465            elif "gains" not in normalized_cfg and config is not None:
 466                try:
 467                    normalized_cfg["gains"] = _get_default_gains(controller_name, config, None)
 468                except Exception as e:
 469                    logger.debug(f"Could not get default gains for {controller_name}: {e}")
 470                    pass  # OK: Let the controller handle missing gains
 471            
 472            # Try from_config method first, then constructor
 473            try:
 474                if hasattr(controller_class, "from_config"):
 475                    # If permissive, pass through as-is; from_config should decide.
 476                    instance = controller_class.from_config(normalized_cfg)
 477                else:
 478                    # In permissive mode, filter kwargs by the constructor signature.
 479                    if allow_unknown:
 480                        import inspect
 481                        sig = inspect.signature(controller_class)
 482                        valid = {p.name for p in sig.parameters.values()
 483                                 if p.kind in (p.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD, p.KEYWORD_ONLY)}
 484                        filtered = {k: v for k, v in normalized_cfg.items() if k in valid}
 485                        unknown = {k: v for k, v in normalized_cfg.items() if k not in valid}
 486                        instance = controller_class(**filtered)
 487                        if unknown:
 488                            instance.unknown_params = {**getattr(instance, "unknown_params", {}), **unknown}
 489                    else:
 490                        instance = controller_class(**normalized_cfg)
 491                
 492                # Store unknown params if in permissive mode
 493                if allow_unknown and hasattr(cfg, "unknown_params"):
 494                    instance.unknown_params = cfg.unknown_params
 495                
 496                logger.info(f"Successfully built controller '{controller_name}'")
 497                return instance
 498                
 499            except (TypeError, ValueError) as e:
 500                # Wrap with dot-path
 501                error_msg = str(e)
 502                if "unexpected keyword argument" in error_msg:
 503                    import re
 504                    match = re.search(r"'(\w+)'", error_msg)
 505                    if match:
 506                        unknown_key = match.group(1)
 507                        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 508                            f"controllers.{controller_name}.{unknown_key}: Unknown parameter. "
 509                            f"Error: {error_msg}"
 510                        )
 511                raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 512                    f"controllers.{controller_name}: Failed to construct. Error: {error_msg}"
 513                )
 514    
 515    # Fall back to legacy create_controller for backward compatibility
 516    logger.debug(f"Controller '{controller_name}' not in registry, trying legacy construction")
 517    return _legacy_create_controller(name, cfg, config, gains, allow_unknown)
 518
 519def build_all(
 520    controllers_cfg: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any],
 521    *,
 522    allow_unknown: bool = False,
 523    config: Optional[Any] = None
 524) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 525    """
 526    Build all controllers from a ControllersConfig.
 527    
 528    Parameters
 529    ----------
 530    controllers_cfg : ControllersConfig or dict
 531        Configuration for all controllers.
 532    allow_unknown : bool
 533        If True, unknown parameters are stored on instances.
 534        If False, unknown parameters raise errors.
 535    config : optional
 536        Full configuration object for defaults.
 537    
 538    Returns
 539    -------
 540    dict[str, Controller]
 541        Mapping of controller names to instances.
 542    
 543    Raises
 544    ------
 545    FactoryConfigurationError
 546        If any controller fails to build (aggregates all errors).
 547    """
 548    built_controllers = {}
 549    errors = []
 550    
 551    # Handle different config types
 552    if hasattr(controllers_cfg, "items"):
 553        items = controllers_cfg.items()
 554    elif hasattr(controllers_cfg, "keys"):
 555        items = [(k, getattr(controllers_cfg, k)) for k in controllers_cfg.keys()]
 556    else:
 557        items = _as_dict(controllers_cfg).items()
 558    
 559    for name, controller_cfg in items:
 560        try:
 561            controller = build_controller(
 562                name, 
 563                controller_cfg, 
 564                allow_unknown=allow_unknown,
 565                config=config
 566            )
 567            built_controllers[name] = controller
 568        except Exception as e:
 569            errors.append(f"controllers.{name}: {str(e)}")
 570    
 571    if errors:
 572        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 573            "Failed to build controllers:\n" + "\n".join(errors)
 574        )
 575    
 576    logger.info(f"Successfully built {len(built_controllers)} controllers: {list(built_controllers.keys())}")
 577    return built_controllers
 578
 579# ---------- Legacy Support ----------
 580def _legacy_create_controller(
 581    ctrl_name: str,
 582    ctrl_cfg: Any,
 583    config: Optional[Any],
 584    gains: Optional[List[float]],
 585    allow_unknown: bool
 586) -> Any:
 587    """Legacy controller creation for backward compatibility."""
 588    # Load config if needed
 589    if config is None:
 590        if load_config is None:
 591            raise RuntimeError("No configuration loader available. Provide 'config' explicitly.")
 592        config = load_config("config.yaml")
 593    
 594    # Handle global seed if present
 595    try:
 596        if hasattr(config, "global_seed") and config.global_seed is not None:
 597            set_global_seed(config.global_seed)
 598            logger.debug(f"Set global seed to {config.global_seed}")
 599    except Exception as e:
 600        logger.debug(f"Could not set global seed: {e}")
 601    
 602    key = normalize_controller_name(ctrl_name)
 603    
 604    # Get controllers from config
 605    controllers_map = _as_dict(getattr(config, "controllers", {}))
 606    
 607    # Legacy classical_smc aliasing
 608    if key not in controllers_map and key == "classical_smc" and "classic_smc" in controllers_map:
 609        key = "classic_smc"
 610    
 611    if key not in controllers_map:
 612        available = "none configured" if len(controllers_map) == 0 else ", ".join(sorted(controllers_map.keys()))
 613        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 614            f"Controller '{ctrl_name}' not found in config.controllers. Available: {available}"
 615        )
 616    
 617    # Get dynamics model preference
 618    use_full = False
 619    try:
 620        sim_cfg = getattr(config, "simulation", None)
 621        if sim_cfg is not None:
 622            use_full = bool(getattr(sim_cfg, "use_full_dynamics", False))
 623    except Exception as e:
 624        logger.debug(f"Could not determine dynamics model preference: {e}")
 625        use_full = False  # OK: Default to simplified dynamics
 626    
 627    _ensure_dynamics_available(use_full)
 628    
 629    # Get controller config and merge with overrides
 630    ctrl_cfg_obj = controllers_map.get(key, {})
 631    ctrl_cfg_dict = _as_dict(ctrl_cfg_obj)
 632    
 633    # Merge any provided cfg
 634    if ctrl_cfg is not None:
 635        override_dict = _as_dict(ctrl_cfg)
 636        ctrl_cfg_dict.update(override_dict)
 637    
 638    # Apply normalization and deprecation
 639    ctrl_cfg_dict = apply_deprecation_mapping(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, allow_unknown)
 640    
 641    # Build dynamics model
 642    dynamics_model = None
 643    try:
 644        phys = getattr(config, "physics", None)
 645        if phys is not None:
 646            if use_full:
 647                dynamics_model = FullDIPDynamics(phys)
 648            else:
 649                dynamics_model = DoubleInvertedPendulum(phys)
 650    except Exception as e:
 651        logger.debug(f"Could not build dynamics model: {e}")
 652        dynamics_model = None  # OK: Controller may not require dynamics
 653    
 654    # Get shared parameters
 655    try:
 656        sim_cfg = getattr(config, "simulation", None)
 657        sim_dt = getattr(sim_cfg, "dt", None) if sim_cfg is not None else None
 658    except Exception as e:
 659        logger.debug(f"Could not extract simulation dt parameter: {e}")
 660        sim_dt = None  # OK: Controller may have dt in its own config
 661    
 662    dt_in_cfg = "dt" in ctrl_cfg_dict
 663    mf_in_cfg = "max_force" in ctrl_cfg_dict
 664    
 665    if dt_in_cfg:
 666        shared_dt = float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("dt"))
 667    else:
 668        shared_dt = float(sim_dt if sim_dt is not None else 0.01)
 669        logger.warning(
 670            f"controllers.{key}: no 'dt' specified; inheriting dt={shared_dt} from simulation configuration."
 671        )
 672    
 673    if mf_in_cfg:
 674        shared_max_force = float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("max_force"))
 675    else:
 676        shared_max_force = 20.0
 677        logger.warning(
 678            f"controllers.{key}: no 'max_force' specified; using default max_force={shared_max_force}."
 679        )
 680    
 681    _validate_shared_params(key, shared_dt, shared_max_force)
 682    
 683    # Delegate to specific controller construction
 684    # This is the legacy if/elif chain from the original factory
 685    # We keep it for backward compatibility
 686    
 687    if key == "classical_smc":
 688        return _build_classical_smc(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, dynamics_model, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
 689    elif key == "sta_smc":
 690        return _build_sta_smc(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, dynamics_model, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
 691    elif key == "adaptive_smc":
 692        return _build_adaptive_smc(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
 693    elif key == "swing_up_smc":
 694        return _build_swing_up_smc(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, dynamics_model, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
 695    elif key == "hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc":
 696        return _build_hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, dynamics_model, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
 697    elif key == "mpc_controller":
 698        return _build_mpc_controller(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
 699    else:
 700        raise FactoryConfigurationError(f"Controller '{ctrl_name}' is not a recognized type.")
 701
 702# Individual controller builders (legacy)
 703def _build_classical_smc(key: str, ctrl_cfg_dict: Dict[str, Any], config: Any, gains: List[float], dynamics_model: Optional[Any], shared_dt: float, shared_max_force: float, allow_unknown: bool) -> Any:
 704    if ClassicalSMC is None:
 705        raise ImportError(
 706            "Controller 'classical_smc' is unavailable (import error). Ensure required modules are importable."
 707        )
 708    
 709    allowed = {
 710        "dt", "max_force", "damping_gain", "boundary_layer", 
 711        "switch_method", "regularization", "gains"
 712    }
 713    unknown_keys = set(ctrl_cfg_dict.keys()) - allowed
 714    
 715    if unknown_keys and not allow_unknown:
 716        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 717            f"controllers.{key}: Unknown configuration keys: {', '.join(sorted(unknown_keys))}. "
 718            f"Allowed keys: {', '.join(sorted(allowed))}"
 719        )
 720    
 721    boundary_layer = float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("boundary_layer", 0.01))
 722    if boundary_layer <= 0:
 723        raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{key}.boundary_layer must be > 0 (got {boundary_layer})")
 724    
 725    switch_method = ctrl_cfg_dict.get("switch_method")
 726    if switch_method is not None:
 727        switch_method = str(switch_method).lower().strip()
 728        if switch_method not in ("tanh", "linear"):
 729            raise ConfigValueError(
 730                f"controllers.{key}.switch_method must be one of ['tanh','linear'] (got {switch_method!r})"
 731            )
 732    
 733    regularization = float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("regularization", 1e-10))
 734    gains_to_use = _get_default_gains(key, config, gains)
 735    
 736    instance = ClassicalSMC(
 737        gains=gains_to_use,
 738        dynamics_model=dynamics_model,
 739        max_force=shared_max_force,
 740        boundary_layer=boundary_layer,
 741        regularization=regularization,
 742        **({"switch_method": switch_method} if switch_method else {}),
 743    )
 744    
 745    if allow_unknown and unknown_keys:
 746        instance.unknown_params = {k: ctrl_cfg_dict[k] for k in unknown_keys}
 747    
 748    return instance
 749
 750def _build_sta_smc(key: str, ctrl_cfg_dict: Dict[str, Any], config: Any, gains: List[float], dynamics_model: Optional[Any], shared_dt: float, shared_max_force: float, allow_unknown: bool) -> Any:
 751    if SuperTwistingSMC is None:
 752        raise ImportError(
 753            "Controller 'sta_smc' is unavailable (import error). Ensure required modules are importable."
 754        )
 755    
 756    allowed = {
 757        "dt", "max_force", "damping_gain", "boundary_layer", 
 758        "switch_method", "regularization", "anti_windup_gain", "gains"
 759    }
 760    unknown_keys = set(ctrl_cfg_dict.keys()) - allowed
 761    
 762    if unknown_keys and not allow_unknown:
 763        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 764            f"controllers.{key}: Unknown configuration keys: {', '.join(sorted(unknown_keys))}. "
 765            f"Allowed keys: {', '.join(sorted(allowed))}"
 766        )
 767    
 768    boundary_layer = float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("boundary_layer", 0.01))
 769    if boundary_layer <= 0:
 770        raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{key}.boundary_layer must be > 0 (got {boundary_layer})")
 771    
 772    switch_method = ctrl_cfg_dict.get("switch_method")
 773    if switch_method is not None:
 774        switch_method = str(switch_method).lower().strip()
 775        if switch_method not in ("tanh", "linear"):
 776            raise ConfigValueError(
 777                f"controllers.{key}.switch_method must be one of ['tanh','linear'] (got {switch_method!r})"
 778            )
 779    
 780    regularization = float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("regularization", 1e-10))
 781    gains_to_use = _get_default_gains(key, config, gains)
 782    
 783    instance = SuperTwistingSMC(
 784        gains=gains_to_use,
 785        dynamics_model=dynamics_model,
 786        max_force=shared_max_force,
 787        damping_gain=float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("damping_gain", 0.0)),
 788        boundary_layer=boundary_layer,
 789        dt=shared_dt,
 790        regularization=regularization,
 791        **({"switch_method": switch_method} if switch_method else {}),
 792        **({"anti_windup_gain": float(ctrl_cfg_dict["anti_windup_gain"])} if "anti_windup_gain" in ctrl_cfg_dict else {}),
 793    )
 794    
 795    if allow_unknown and unknown_keys:
 796        instance.unknown_params = {k: ctrl_cfg_dict[k] for k in unknown_keys}
 797    
 798    return instance
 799
 800def _build_adaptive_smc(key: str, ctrl_cfg_dict: Dict[str, Any], config: Any, gains: List[float], shared_dt: float, shared_max_force: float, allow_unknown: bool) -> Any:
 801    if AdaptiveSMC is None:
 802        raise ImportError(
 803            "Controller 'adaptive_smc' is unavailable (import error). Ensure required modules are importable."
 804        )
 805    
 806    allowed = {
 807        "dt", "max_force", "leak_rate", "dead_zone", "adapt_rate_limit",
 808        "K_min", "K_max", "smooth_switch", "boundary_layer", "K_init", "alpha", "gains"
 809    }
 810    unknown_keys = set(ctrl_cfg_dict.keys()) - allowed
 811    
 812    if unknown_keys and not allow_unknown:
 813        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 814            f"controllers.{key}: Unknown configuration keys: {', '.join(sorted(unknown_keys))}. "
 815            f"Allowed keys: {', '.join(sorted(allowed))}"
 816        )
 817    
 818    gains_to_use = _get_default_gains(key, config, gains)
 819    filtered = {k: v for k, v in ctrl_cfg_dict.items() if k in allowed}
 820    filtered.setdefault("dt", shared_dt)
 821    filtered.setdefault("max_force", shared_max_force)
 822    
 823    if "boundary_layer" in filtered:
 824        bl = float(filtered["boundary_layer"])
 825        if bl <= 0:
 826            raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{key}.boundary_layer must be > 0 (got {bl})")
 827    
 828    instance = AdaptiveSMC(gains=gains_to_use, **filtered)
 829    
 830    if allow_unknown and unknown_keys:
 831        instance.unknown_params = {k: ctrl_cfg_dict[k] for k in unknown_keys}
 832    
 833    return instance
 834
 835def _build_swing_up_smc(key: str, ctrl_cfg_dict: Dict[str, Any], config: Any, gains: List[float], dynamics_model: Optional[Any], shared_dt: float, shared_max_force: float, allow_unknown: bool) -> Any:
 836    if SwingUpSMC is None:
 837        raise ImportError(
 838            "Controller 'swing_up_smc' is unavailable (import error). Ensure required modules are importable."
 839        )
 840    
 841    allowed = {
 842        "dt", "max_force", "stabilizing_controller", "energy_gain",
 843        "switch_energy_factor", "exit_energy_factor", "switch_angle_tolerance",
 844        "reentry_angle_tolerance", "gains"
 845    }
 846    unknown_keys = set(ctrl_cfg_dict.keys()) - allowed
 847    
 848    if unknown_keys and not allow_unknown:
 849        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 850            f"controllers.{key}: Unknown configuration keys: {', '.join(sorted(unknown_keys))}. "
 851            f"Allowed keys: {', '.join(sorted(allowed))}"
 852        )
 853    
 854    inner_name = ctrl_cfg_dict.get("stabilizing_controller", "classical_smc")
 855    normalized_inner = normalize_controller_name(inner_name)
 856    if normalized_inner == "swing_up_smc":
 857        raise ConfigValueError("swing_up_smc cannot use itself as stabilizing_controller.")
 858    
 859    # Recursively build stabilizer
 860    stabilizer = build_controller(inner_name, {}, config=config, gains=None)
 861    
 862    max_force = float(
 863        ctrl_cfg_dict.get("max_force", getattr(stabilizer, "max_force", shared_max_force))
 864    )
 865    
 866    instance = SwingUpSMC(
 867        dynamics_model=dynamics_model,
 868        stabilizing_controller=stabilizer,
 869        energy_gain=float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("energy_gain", 50.0)),
 870        switch_energy_factor=float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("switch_energy_factor", 0.95)),
 871        exit_energy_factor=float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("exit_energy_factor", 0.90)),
 872        switch_angle_tolerance=float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("switch_angle_tolerance", 0.35)),
 873        reentry_angle_tolerance=float(
 874            ctrl_cfg_dict.get(
 875                "reentry_angle_tolerance",
 876                ctrl_cfg_dict.get("switch_angle_tolerance", 0.35),
 877            )
 878        ),
 879        dt=shared_dt,
 880        max_force=max_force,
 881    )
 882    
 883    if allow_unknown and unknown_keys:
 884        instance.unknown_params = {k: ctrl_cfg_dict[k] for k in unknown_keys}
 885    
 886    return instance
 887
 888def _build_hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc(key: str, ctrl_cfg_dict: Dict[str, Any], config: Any, gains: List[float], dynamics_model: Optional[Any], shared_dt: float, shared_max_force: float, allow_unknown: bool) -> Any:
 889    if HybridAdaptiveSTASMC is None:
 890        raise ImportError(
 891            "Controller 'hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc' is unavailable (import error)."
 892        )
 893    
 894    allowed = {
 895        "dt", "max_force", "k1_init", "k2_init", "gamma1", "gamma2", "dead_zone",
 896        "use_equivalent", "enable_equivalent", "damping_gain", "adapt_rate_limit",
 897        "sat_soft_width", "cart_gain", "cart_lambda", "cart_p_gain", "cart_p_lambda", "gains"
 898    }
 899    unknown_keys = set(ctrl_cfg_dict.keys()) - allowed
 900    
 901    if unknown_keys and not allow_unknown:
 902        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 903            f"controllers.{key}: Unknown configuration keys: {', '.join(sorted(unknown_keys))}. "
 904            f"Allowed keys: {', '.join(sorted(allowed))}"
 905        )
 906    
 907    gains_to_use = _get_default_gains(key, config, gains)
 908    
 909    filtered = {
 910        k: v for k, v in ctrl_cfg_dict.items()
 911        if k in allowed
 912    }
 913    filtered.setdefault("dt", shared_dt)
 914    filtered.setdefault("max_force", shared_max_force)
 915    
 916    # Handle equivalent control flags
 917    eq_kwargs = {}
 918    if "enable_equivalent" in filtered:
 919        eq_kwargs["enable_equivalent"] = bool(filtered.pop("enable_equivalent"))
 920    if "use_equivalent" in filtered:
 921        eq_kwargs["use_equivalent"] = bool(filtered.pop("use_equivalent"))
 922    
 923    instance = HybridAdaptiveSTASMC(
 924        gains=gains_to_use,
 925        dt=float(filtered.get("dt", shared_dt)),
 926        max_force=float(filtered.get("max_force", shared_max_force)),
 927        k1_init=float(filtered.get("k1_init", 0.0)),
 928        k2_init=float(filtered.get("k2_init", 0.0)),
 929        gamma1=float(filtered.get("gamma1", 0.0)),
 930        gamma2=float(filtered.get("gamma2", 0.0)),
 931        dead_zone=float(filtered.get("dead_zone", 0.0)),
 932        damping_gain=float(filtered.get("damping_gain", 3.0)),
 933        adapt_rate_limit=float(filtered.get("adapt_rate_limit", 5.0)),
 934        sat_soft_width=float(filtered.get("sat_soft_width", 0.03)),
 935        cart_gain=float(filtered.get("cart_gain", 0.5)),
 936        cart_lambda=float(filtered.get("cart_lambda", 1.0)),
 937        cart_p_gain=float(filtered.get("cart_p_gain", 80.0)),
 938        cart_p_lambda=float(filtered.get("cart_p_lambda", 2.0)),
 939        dynamics_model=dynamics_model,
 940        **eq_kwargs,
 941    )
 942    
 943    if allow_unknown and unknown_keys:
 944        instance.unknown_params = {k: ctrl_cfg_dict[k] for k in unknown_keys}
 945    
 946    return instance
 947
 948def _build_mpc_controller(key: str, ctrl_cfg_dict: Dict[str, Any], config: Any, gains: List[float], shared_dt: float, shared_max_force: float, allow_unknown: bool) -> Any:
 949    # Check for dynamically available MPCController (handles monkeypatch scenarios)
 950    current_mpc_controller = MPCController
 951    if current_mpc_controller is None:
 952        # Check if MPCController has been monkeypatched in globals
 953        import sys
 954        current_module = sys.modules[__name__]
 955        if hasattr(current_module, 'MPCController') and getattr(current_module, 'MPCController') is not None:
 956            current_mpc_controller = getattr(current_module, 'MPCController')
 957
 958    if current_mpc_controller is None:
 959        raise ImportError(
 960            "MPC controller missing optional dependency"
 961        )
 962    
 963    allowed = {
 964        "dt", "max_force", "horizon", "q_x", "q_theta", "r_u",
 965        "max_theta_dev", "max_cart_pos", "fallback_smc_gains",
 966        "fallback_pd_kp", "fallback_pd_kd", "gains"
 967    }
 968    unknown_keys = set(ctrl_cfg_dict.keys()) - allowed
 969    
 970    if unknown_keys and not allow_unknown:
 971        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 972            f"controllers.{key}: Unknown configuration keys: {', '.join(sorted(unknown_keys))}. "
 973            f"Allowed keys: {', '.join(sorted(allowed))}"
 974        )
 975    
 976    # Validate MPC params
 977    if "horizon" in ctrl_cfg_dict:
 978        hv = ctrl_cfg_dict["horizon"]
 979        if not isinstance(hv, int):
 980            raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{key}.horizon must be an integer â‰¥ 1 (got {hv!r})")
 981        horizon = hv
 982        if horizon < 1:
 983            raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{key}.horizon must be â‰¥ 1 (got {horizon})")
 984    
 985    max_cart_pos = float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("max_cart_pos", 1.5))
 986    if not (math.isfinite(max_cart_pos) and max_cart_pos > 0):
 987        raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{key}.max_cart_pos must be > 0 (got {max_cart_pos})")
 988    
 989    if "max_theta_dev" in ctrl_cfg_dict:
 990        mtd = float(ctrl_cfg_dict["max_theta_dev"])
 991        if not (math.isfinite(mtd) and mtd > 0):
 992            raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{key}.max_theta_dev must be > 0 when provided (got {mtd})")
 993    
 994    for wkey in ("q_x", "q_theta", "r_u"):
 995        if wkey in ctrl_cfg_dict:
 996            val = float(ctrl_cfg_dict[wkey])
 997            if val < 0:
 998                raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{key}.{wkey} must be â‰¥ 0 (got {val})")
 999    
1000    # Build dummy dynamics
1001    class _DummyDyn:
1002        def __init__(self):
1003            self.state_dim = 6
1004        def step(self, state, u, dt):
1005            return np.asarray(state, dtype=float)
1006        def f(self, x, u):
1007            return np.zeros_like(x)
1008        continuous_dynamics = f
1009    
1010    prediction_model = _DummyDyn()
1011    
1012    # Build weights
1013    q_x = ctrl_cfg_dict.get("q_x")
1014    q_theta = ctrl_cfg_dict.get("q_theta")
1015    r_u = ctrl_cfg_dict.get("r_u")
1016    if any(v is not None for v in (q_x, q_theta, r_u)):
1017        weight_kwargs = {}
1018        if q_x is not None:
1019            weight_kwargs["q_x"] = float(q_x)
1020        if q_theta is not None:
1021            weight_kwargs["q_theta"] = float(q_theta)
1022        if r_u is not None:
1023            weight_kwargs["r_u"] = float(r_u)
1024        weights = MPCWeights(**weight_kwargs)
1025    else:
1026        weights = None
1027    
1028    theta_dev = ctrl_cfg_dict.get("max_theta_dev", None)
1029    mpc_kwargs = {
1030        "dynamics_model": prediction_model,
1031        "horizon": int(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("horizon", 20)),
1032        "dt": float(shared_dt),
1033        "max_force": float(shared_max_force),
1034        "weights": weights,
1035        "max_cart_pos": float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("max_cart_pos", 1.5)),
1036    }
1037    if theta_dev is not None:
1038        mpc_kwargs["max_theta_dev"] = float(theta_dev)
1039    
1040    # Handle fallback gains
1041    fb_smc = ctrl_cfg_dict.get("fallback_smc_gains", None)
1042    if fb_smc is not None:
1043        try:
1044            mpc_kwargs["fallback_smc_gains"] = [float(x) for x in fb_smc]
1045        except (ValueError, TypeError) as e:  # P0: Handle invalid SMC gains format
1046            logger.warning(
1047                f"controllers.{key}: fallback_smc_gains must be numeric sequence, got {fb_smc!r}: {e}. Ignoring."
1048            )
1049    
1050    fb_kp = ctrl_cfg_dict.get("fallback_pd_kp", None)
1051    fb_kd = ctrl_cfg_dict.get("fallback_pd_kd", None)
1052    if fb_kp is not None and fb_kd is not None:
1053        try:
1054            mpc_kwargs["fallback_pd_gains"] = (float(fb_kp), float(fb_kd))
1055        except (ValueError, TypeError) as e:  # P0: Handle invalid PD gains
1056            logger.warning(
1057                f"controllers.{key}: fallback_pd_kp/kd must be numeric, got kp={fb_kp}, kd={fb_kd}: {e}. Using defaults."
1058            )
1059    
1060    instance = current_mpc_controller(**mpc_kwargs)
1061    
1062    if allow_unknown and unknown_keys:
1063        instance.unknown_params = {k: ctrl_cfg_dict[k] for k in unknown_keys}
1064    
1065    return instance
1066
1067# ---------- Backward Compatibility ----------
1068# Keep create_controller for backward compatibility
1069def create_controller(name: str, /, **kwargs: Any) -> Any:
1070    """
1071    Backwards-compatible convenience wrapper used by tests and the CLI.
1072    Delegates to build_controller() so mapping/validation stays centralized.
1073
1074    Parameters
1075    ----------
1076    name : str
1077        Controller name (aliases allowed).
1078    **kwargs :
1079        Per-controller constructor args (e.g., gains, dt, max_force).
1080    """
1081    # Unknown *controller names* must still raise.
1082    # allow_unknown=True relaxes parameter filtering only.
1083
1084    # Normalize controller name
1085    controller_name = normalize_controller_name(name)
1086
1087    # Check registry first
1088    with CONTROLLER_REGISTRY_LOCK:
1089        if controller_name in CONTROLLER_REGISTRY:
1090            return build_controller(name, kwargs, allow_unknown=True)
1091
1092    # For tests and direct usage, try to create directly without config.yaml
1093    # Apply deprecation mapping first
1094    normalized_kwargs = apply_deprecation_mapping(controller_name, kwargs, allow_unknown=True)
1095
1096    # Handle direct controller construction for common cases
1097    if controller_name == "classical_smc" and ClassicalSMC is not None:
1098        # Extract required parameters
1099        gains = normalized_kwargs.get('gains')
1100        if gains is None:
1101            raise ValueError(f"Controller '{name}': gains parameter is required")
1102
1103        max_force = normalized_kwargs.get('max_force', 20.0)
1104        boundary_layer = normalized_kwargs.get('boundary_layer', 0.01)
1105
1106        # Filter known parameters
1107        known_params = {
1108            'gains': gains,
1109            'max_force': max_force,
1110            'boundary_layer': boundary_layer,
1111            'dynamics_model': normalized_kwargs.get('dynamics_model'),
1112            'regularization': normalized_kwargs.get('regularization', 1e-10),
1113            'switch_method': normalized_kwargs.get('switch_method', 'tanh'),
1114        }
1115
1116        # Remove None values
1117        filtered_params = {k: v for k, v in known_params.items() if v is not None}
1118
1119        return ClassicalSMC(**filtered_params)
1120
1121    elif controller_name == "sta_smc" and SuperTwistingSMC is not None:
1122        # Similar handling for SuperTwistingSMC
1123        gains = normalized_kwargs.get('gains')
1124        if gains is None:
1125            raise ValueError(f"Controller '{name}': gains parameter is required")
1126
1127        max_force = normalized_kwargs.get('max_force', 20.0)
1128        boundary_layer = normalized_kwargs.get('boundary_layer', 0.01)
1129        dt = normalized_kwargs.get('dt', 0.01)
1130
1131        known_params = {
1132            'gains': gains,
1133            'max_force': max_force,
1134            'boundary_layer': boundary_layer,
1135            'dt': dt,
1136            'dynamics_model': normalized_kwargs.get('dynamics_model'),
1137            'damping_gain': normalized_kwargs.get('damping_gain', 0.0),
1138            'regularization': normalized_kwargs.get('regularization', 1e-10),
1139            'switch_method': normalized_kwargs.get('switch_method', 'tanh'),
1140        }
1141
1142        # Handle optional anti_windup_gain
1143        if 'anti_windup_gain' in normalized_kwargs:
1144            known_params['anti_windup_gain'] = normalized_kwargs['anti_windup_gain']
1145
1146        filtered_params = {k: v for k, v in known_params.items() if v is not None}
1147
1148        return SuperTwistingSMC(**filtered_params)
1149
1150    elif controller_name == "adaptive_smc" and AdaptiveSMC is not None:
1151        # Similar handling for AdaptiveSMC with required defaults
1152        gains = normalized_kwargs.get('gains')
1153        if gains is None:
1154            raise ValueError(f"Controller '{name}': gains parameter is required")
1155
1156        known_params = {
1157            'gains': gains,
1158            'dt': normalized_kwargs.get('dt', 0.01),
1159            'max_force': normalized_kwargs.get('max_force', 20.0),
1160            'leak_rate': normalized_kwargs.get('leak_rate', 0.1),
1161            'dead_zone': normalized_kwargs.get('dead_zone', 0.01),
1162            'adapt_rate_limit': normalized_kwargs.get('adapt_rate_limit', 100.0),
1163            'K_min': normalized_kwargs.get('K_min', 0.1),
1164            'K_max': normalized_kwargs.get('K_max', 100.0),
1165            'smooth_switch': normalized_kwargs.get('smooth_switch', True),
1166            'boundary_layer': normalized_kwargs.get('boundary_layer', 0.01),
1167            'K_init': normalized_kwargs.get('K_init', 10.0),
1168            'alpha': normalized_kwargs.get('alpha', 0.5),
1169        }
1170
1171        # All parameters have defaults, so just pass them all
1172        return AdaptiveSMC(**known_params)
1173
1174    # For unknown controller names or when direct construction fails,
1175    # fall back to full build_controller with config loading
1176    try:
1177        config = kwargs.pop('config', None)
1178        gains = kwargs.pop('gains', None)
1179
1180        return build_controller(
1181            name,
1182            kwargs,
1183            config=config,
1184            gains=gains,
1185            allow_unknown=True
1186        )
1187    except ImportError:
1188        # Re-raise ImportError for missing dependencies
1189        raise
1190    except ConfigValueError:
1191        # Re-raise ConfigValueError for validation errors
1192        raise
1193    except Exception:
1194        # If all else fails, raise error for unknown controller
1195        raise ValueError(f"Controller '{name}' is not a recognized type")
1196
1197# Expose the canonical name helper for backward compat
1198def _canonical(name: str) -> str:
1199    """
1200    Legacy/compat alias for tests. Mirrors normalize_controller_name().
1201    """
1202    return normalize_controller_name(name)

_try_import(primary_mod, fallback_mod, attr)¶

Try importing attr from primary_mod then fallback_mod.

Source Code¶

 1def _try_import(primary_mod: str, fallback_mod: str, attr: str) -> Any:
 2    """Try importing ``attr`` from ``primary_mod`` then ``fallback_mod``."""
 3    try:
 4        mod = __import__(primary_mod, fromlist=[attr])
 5        return getattr(mod, attr)
 6    except Exception:
 7        try:
 8            mod = __import__(fallback_mod, fromlist=[attr])
 9            return getattr(mod, attr)
10        except Exception as e:
11            raise ImportError(
12                f"Could not import {attr} from either '{primary_mod}' or '{fallback_mod}': {e!s}"
13            )

normalize_controller_name(name)¶

Normalize controller name and apply aliases.

Lowercase, trim, replace hyphens/spaces/dots with underscores, then check alias map.

Source Code¶

 1def normalize_controller_name(name: str) -> str:
 2    """
 3    Normalize controller name and apply aliases.
 4    
 5    Lowercase, trim, replace hyphens/spaces/dots with underscores,
 6    then check alias map.
 7    """
 8    if not name:
 9        return ""
10    
11    # Basic normalization
12    normalized = name.lower().strip()
13    for char in ["-", " ", "."]:
14        normalized = normalized.replace(char, "_")
15    
16    # Apply alias mapping
17    canonical = ALIAS_MAP.get(normalized, normalized)
18    
19    if normalized != canonical:
20        logger.debug(f"Controller name '{name}' normalized to '{canonical}' via alias")
21    elif name != normalized:
22        logger.debug(f"Controller name '{name}' normalized to '{normalized}'")
23    
24    return canonical

normalize_param_key(key)¶

Normalize parameter key: lowercase, replace hyphens/spaces with underscores.

Source Code¶

 1def normalize_param_key(key: str) -> str:
 2    """Normalize parameter key: lowercase, replace hyphens/spaces with underscores."""
 3    if not key:
 4        return ""
 5    # Special case: preserve capitalization for K_ parameters
 6    if key.startswith('K_'):
 7        normalized = key.strip()
 8        for char in ["-", " "]:
 9            normalized = normalized.replace(char, "_")
10        return normalized
11    normalized = key.lower().strip()
12    for char in ["-", " "]:
13        normalized = normalized.replace(char, "_")
14    return normalized

apply_deprecation_mapping(controller_name, params, allow_unknown)¶

Apply deprecation mapping for a controller’s parameters.

Returns normalized params dict with deprecated keys mapped to current ones. Emits DeprecationWarning for each deprecated key found.

Source Code¶

 1def apply_deprecation_mapping(
 2    controller_name: str, 
 3    params: Dict[str, Any], 
 4    allow_unknown: bool = False
 5) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 6    """
 7    Apply deprecation mapping for a controller's parameters.
 8    
 9    Returns normalized params dict with deprecated keys mapped to current ones.
10    Emits DeprecationWarning for each deprecated key found.
11    """
12    deprecation_map = DEPRECATED_PARAM_MAP.get(controller_name, {})
13    normalized_params = {}
14
15    # Track which normalized keys we've seen to detect collisions
16    seen_normalized = {}
17    
18    for original_key, value in params.items():
19        # First normalize the key
20        norm_key = normalize_param_key(original_key)
21        
22        # Check for deprecation (use original key for deprecation lookup)
23        if original_key in deprecation_map:
24            new_key = deprecation_map[original_key]
25            # Only apply deprecation if the new key isn't already set
26            if new_key not in params and new_key not in normalized_params:
27                warnings.warn(
28                    f"Parameter '{original_key}' is deprecated for {controller_name}. "
29                    f"Please use '{new_key}' instead.",
30                    DeprecationWarning,
31                    stacklevel=3
32                )
33                logger.debug(f"Mapped deprecated param '{original_key}' -> '{new_key}' for {controller_name}")
34                norm_key = new_key
35            else:
36                # New key already set, skip the deprecated one
37                logger.debug(f"Skipping deprecated param '{original_key}' as '{new_key}' is already set")
38                continue
39        # Also check normalized form in deprecation map
40        elif norm_key in deprecation_map:
41            new_key = deprecation_map[norm_key]
42            if new_key not in params and new_key not in normalized_params:
43                warnings.warn(
44                    f"Parameter '{original_key}' (normalized: '{norm_key}') is deprecated for {controller_name}. "
45                    f"Please use '{new_key}' instead.",
46                    DeprecationWarning,
47                    stacklevel=3
48                )
49                logger.debug(f"Mapped deprecated param '{norm_key}' -> '{new_key}' for {controller_name}")
50                norm_key = new_key
51            else:
52                continue
53        
54        # Check for key collision after normalization
55        if norm_key in seen_normalized and seen_normalized[norm_key] != original_key:
56            raise FactoryConfigurationError(
57                f"controllers.{controller_name}: Parameter keys '{seen_normalized[norm_key]}' "
58                f"and '{original_key}' both normalize to '{norm_key}'"
59            )
60        
61        seen_normalized[norm_key] = original_key
62        normalized_params[norm_key] = value
63    
64    return normalized_params

redact_value(value)¶

Redact sensitive values for logging.

Source Code¶

1def redact_value(value: Any) -> str:
2    """Redact sensitive values for logging."""
3    if value is None:
4        return "None"
5    value_str = str(value).lower()
6    if any(keyword in value_str for keyword in ["password", "secret", "token", "key", "api"]):
7        return "***"
8    # Also redact if the key name suggests sensitivity
9    return str(value)[:50] + "..." if len(str(value)) > 50 else str(value)

register_controller(name)¶

Decorator for registering controller constructors.

Registration is idempotent - re-registering the same name overwrites.

Source Code¶

 1def register_controller(name: str) -> Callable[[Type[Any]], Type[Any]]:
 2    """
 3    Decorator for registering controller constructors.
 4    
 5    Registration is idempotent - re-registering the same name overwrites.
 6    """
 7    def decorator(cls: Type[Any]) -> Type[Any]:
 8        normalized_name = normalize_controller_name(name)
 9        with CONTROLLER_REGISTRY_LOCK:
10            CONTROLLER_REGISTRY[normalized_name] = cls
11            logger.info(f"Registered controller '{normalized_name}' -> {cls.__name__}")
12        return cls
13    return decorator

_as_dict(obj)¶

Robustly convert an arbitrary object into a plain dict.

Source Code¶

 1def _as_dict(obj: Any) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 2    """Robustly convert an arbitrary object into a plain dict."""
 3    if obj is None:
 4        return {}
 5    if isinstance(obj, dict):
 6        return obj
 7    if hasattr(obj, "model_dump"):
 8        try:
 9            return obj.model_dump(exclude_unset=True)
10        except Exception as e:
11            logger.debug(f"Config conversion via model_dump() failed: {e}")
12            pass  # OK: Try next conversion method
13    if hasattr(obj, "dict"):
14        try:
15            return obj.dict(exclude_unset=True)
16        except Exception as e:
17            logger.debug(f"Config conversion via dict() failed: {e}")
18            pass  # OK: Try next conversion method
19    if hasattr(obj, "__dict__"):
20        return dict(obj.__dict__)
21    try:
22        return dict(obj)
23    except Exception as e:
24        logger.debug(f"Config conversion via dict(obj) failed: {e}")
25        return {}  # OK: Return empty dict as final fallback

_get_default_gains(controller_name, config, gains_override)¶

Get gains from override, defaults, or raise error.

Source Code¶

 1def _get_default_gains(controller_name: str, config: Any, gains_override: Optional[List[float]]) -> List[float]:
 2    """Get gains from override, defaults, or raise error."""
 3    if gains_override is not None:
 4        return list(gains_override)
 5    
 6    try:
 7        defaults_all = _as_dict(getattr(config, "controller_defaults", {}))
 8        defaults = defaults_all.get(controller_name, None)
 9        if isinstance(defaults, dict) and "gains" in defaults:
10            return list(defaults["gains"])
11        if hasattr(defaults, "gains"):
12            return list(defaults.gains)
13    except Exception as e:
14        logger.debug(f"Could not extract default gains for {controller_name}: {e}")
15        pass  # OK: Will raise FactoryConfigurationError below if no gains found
16    
17    raise FactoryConfigurationError(
18        f"controllers.{controller_name}.gains: No gains provided and no defaults found. "
19        f"Please specify 'controller_defaults.{controller_name}.gains' in config or pass gains explicitly."
20    )

 1def _ensure_dynamics_available(use_full: bool) -> None:

 4        raise ImportError(
 5            "FullDIPDynamics is unavailable. Ensure 'src/core/dynamics_full.py' is importable."
 6        )
 7    if (not use_full) and DoubleInvertedPendulum is None:
 8        raise ImportError(

10        )

_validate_shared_params(controller_name, dt, max_force)¶

Validate common parameters shared by controllers.

Source Code¶

1def _validate_shared_params(controller_name: str, dt: float, max_force: float) -> None:
2    """Validate common parameters shared by controllers."""
3    if not (isinstance(dt, numbers.Real) and math.isfinite(float(dt)) and dt > 0):
4        raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{controller_name}.dt must be > 0 (got {dt})")
5    if not (isinstance(max_force, numbers.Real) and math.isfinite(float(max_force)) and max_force > 0):
6        raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{controller_name}.max_force must be finite and > 0 (got {max_force})")

build_controller(name, cfg)¶

Build a single controller from configuration.

Parameters¶

name : str Controller name (will be normalized and aliased). cfg : dict or Mapping or ControllerConfig Controller-specific configuration. allow_unknown : bool If True, unknown parameters are stored as unknown_params on the instance. If False, unknown parameters raise FactoryConfigurationError. config : optional Full configuration object (for backward compatibility). gains : optional Explicit gains override.

Returns¶

Controller instance

Raises¶

FactoryConfigurationError If controller name is unknown or configuration is invalid.

Source Code¶

  1def build_controller(
  2    name: str,
  3    cfg: Union[Dict[str, Any], Mapping[str, Any], Any],
  4    *,
  5    allow_unknown: bool = False,
  6    config: Optional[Any] = None,  # For backward compat with create_controller
  7    gains: Optional[List[float]] = None
  8) -> Any:
  9    """
 10    Build a single controller from configuration.
 11    
 12    Parameters
 13    ----------
 14    name : str
 15        Controller name (will be normalized and aliased).
 16    cfg : dict or Mapping or ControllerConfig
 17        Controller-specific configuration.
 18    allow_unknown : bool
 19        If True, unknown parameters are stored as unknown_params on the instance.
 20        If False, unknown parameters raise FactoryConfigurationError.
 21    config : optional
 22        Full configuration object (for backward compatibility).
 23    gains : optional
 24        Explicit gains override.
 25    
 26    Returns
 27    -------
 28    Controller instance
 29    
 30    Raises
 31    ------
 32    FactoryConfigurationError
 33        If controller name is unknown or configuration is invalid.
 34    """
 35    # Normalize controller name
 36    controller_name = normalize_controller_name(name)
 37    
 38    # Check registry first
 39    with CONTROLLER_REGISTRY_LOCK:
 40        if controller_name in CONTROLLER_REGISTRY:
 41            controller_class = CONTROLLER_REGISTRY[controller_name]
 42            logger.info(f"Building controller '{controller_name}' from registry")
 43            
 44            # Convert config to dict
 45            cfg_dict = _as_dict(cfg)
 46            
 47            # Apply normalization and deprecation
 48            normalized_cfg = apply_deprecation_mapping(controller_name, cfg_dict, allow_unknown)
 49            
 50            # Handle gains
 51            if gains is not None:
 52                normalized_cfg["gains"] = gains
 53            elif "gains" not in normalized_cfg and config is not None:
 54                try:
 55                    normalized_cfg["gains"] = _get_default_gains(controller_name, config, None)
 56                except Exception as e:
 57                    logger.debug(f"Could not get default gains for {controller_name}: {e}")
 58                    pass  # OK: Let the controller handle missing gains
 59            
 60            # Try from_config method first, then constructor
 61            try:
 62                if hasattr(controller_class, "from_config"):
 63                    # If permissive, pass through as-is; from_config should decide.
 64                    instance = controller_class.from_config(normalized_cfg)
 65                else:
 66                    # In permissive mode, filter kwargs by the constructor signature.
 67                    if allow_unknown:
 68                        import inspect
 69                        sig = inspect.signature(controller_class)
 70                        valid = {p.name for p in sig.parameters.values()
 71                                 if p.kind in (p.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD, p.KEYWORD_ONLY)}
 72                        filtered = {k: v for k, v in normalized_cfg.items() if k in valid}
 73                        unknown = {k: v for k, v in normalized_cfg.items() if k not in valid}
 74                        instance = controller_class(**filtered)
 75                        if unknown:
 76                            instance.unknown_params = {**getattr(instance, "unknown_params", {}), **unknown}
 77                    else:
 78                        instance = controller_class(**normalized_cfg)
 79                
 80                # Store unknown params if in permissive mode
 81                if allow_unknown and hasattr(cfg, "unknown_params"):
 82                    instance.unknown_params = cfg.unknown_params
 83                
 84                logger.info(f"Successfully built controller '{controller_name}'")
 85                return instance
 86                
 87            except (TypeError, ValueError) as e:
 88                # Wrap with dot-path
 89                error_msg = str(e)
 90                if "unexpected keyword argument" in error_msg:
 91                    import re
 92                    match = re.search(r"'(\w+)'", error_msg)
 93                    if match:
 94                        unknown_key = match.group(1)
 95                        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 96                            f"controllers.{controller_name}.{unknown_key}: Unknown parameter. "
 97                            f"Error: {error_msg}"
 98                        )
 99                raise FactoryConfigurationError(
100                    f"controllers.{controller_name}: Failed to construct. Error: {error_msg}"
101                )
102    
103    # Fall back to legacy create_controller for backward compatibility
104    logger.debug(f"Controller '{controller_name}' not in registry, trying legacy construction")
105    return _legacy_create_controller(name, cfg, config, gains, allow_unknown)

build_all(controllers_cfg)¶

Build all controllers from a ControllersConfig.

Parameters¶

controllers_cfg : ControllersConfig or dict Configuration for all controllers. allow_unknown : bool If True, unknown parameters are stored on instances. If False, unknown parameters raise errors. config : optional Full configuration object for defaults.

Returns¶

dict[str, Controller] Mapping of controller names to instances.

Raises¶

FactoryConfigurationError If any controller fails to build (aggregates all errors).

Source Code¶

 1def build_all(
 2    controllers_cfg: Union[Dict[str, Any], Any],
 3    *,
 4    allow_unknown: bool = False,
 5    config: Optional[Any] = None
 6) -> Dict[str, Any]:
 7    """
 8    Build all controllers from a ControllersConfig.
 9    
10    Parameters
11    ----------
12    controllers_cfg : ControllersConfig or dict
13        Configuration for all controllers.
14    allow_unknown : bool
15        If True, unknown parameters are stored on instances.
16        If False, unknown parameters raise errors.
17    config : optional
18        Full configuration object for defaults.
19    
20    Returns
21    -------
22    dict[str, Controller]
23        Mapping of controller names to instances.
24    
25    Raises
26    ------
27    FactoryConfigurationError
28        If any controller fails to build (aggregates all errors).
29    """
30    built_controllers = {}
31    errors = []
32    
33    # Handle different config types
34    if hasattr(controllers_cfg, "items"):
35        items = controllers_cfg.items()
36    elif hasattr(controllers_cfg, "keys"):
37        items = [(k, getattr(controllers_cfg, k)) for k in controllers_cfg.keys()]
38    else:
39        items = _as_dict(controllers_cfg).items()
40    
41    for name, controller_cfg in items:
42        try:
43            controller = build_controller(
44                name, 
45                controller_cfg, 
46                allow_unknown=allow_unknown,
47                config=config
48            )
49            built_controllers[name] = controller
50        except Exception as e:
51            errors.append(f"controllers.{name}: {str(e)}")
52    
53    if errors:
54        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
55            "Failed to build controllers:\n" + "\n".join(errors)
56        )
57    
58    logger.info(f"Successfully built {len(built_controllers)} controllers: {list(built_controllers.keys())}")
59    return built_controllers

_legacy_create_controller(ctrl_name, ctrl_cfg, config, gains, allow_unknown)¶

Legacy controller creation for backward compatibility.

Source Code¶

  1def _legacy_create_controller(
  2    ctrl_name: str,
  3    ctrl_cfg: Any,
  4    config: Optional[Any],
  5    gains: Optional[List[float]],
  6    allow_unknown: bool
  7) -> Any:
  8    """Legacy controller creation for backward compatibility."""
  9    # Load config if needed
 10    if config is None:
 11        if load_config is None:
 12            raise RuntimeError("No configuration loader available. Provide 'config' explicitly.")
 13        config = load_config("config.yaml")
 14    
 15    # Handle global seed if present
 16    try:
 17        if hasattr(config, "global_seed") and config.global_seed is not None:
 18            set_global_seed(config.global_seed)
 19            logger.debug(f"Set global seed to {config.global_seed}")
 20    except Exception as e:
 21        logger.debug(f"Could not set global seed: {e}")
 22    
 23    key = normalize_controller_name(ctrl_name)
 24    
 25    # Get controllers from config
 26    controllers_map = _as_dict(getattr(config, "controllers", {}))
 27    
 28    # Legacy classical_smc aliasing
 29    if key not in controllers_map and key == "classical_smc" and "classic_smc" in controllers_map:
 30        key = "classic_smc"
 31    
 32    if key not in controllers_map:
 33        available = "none configured" if len(controllers_map) == 0 else ", ".join(sorted(controllers_map.keys()))
 34        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
 35            f"Controller '{ctrl_name}' not found in config.controllers. Available: {available}"
 36        )
 37    
 38    # Get dynamics model preference
 39    use_full = False
 40    try:
 41        sim_cfg = getattr(config, "simulation", None)
 42        if sim_cfg is not None:
 43            use_full = bool(getattr(sim_cfg, "use_full_dynamics", False))
 44    except Exception as e:
 45        logger.debug(f"Could not determine dynamics model preference: {e}")
 46        use_full = False  # OK: Default to simplified dynamics
 47    
 48    _ensure_dynamics_available(use_full)
 49    
 50    # Get controller config and merge with overrides
 51    ctrl_cfg_obj = controllers_map.get(key, {})
 52    ctrl_cfg_dict = _as_dict(ctrl_cfg_obj)
 53    
 54    # Merge any provided cfg
 55    if ctrl_cfg is not None:
 56        override_dict = _as_dict(ctrl_cfg)
 57        ctrl_cfg_dict.update(override_dict)
 58    
 59    # Apply normalization and deprecation
 60    ctrl_cfg_dict = apply_deprecation_mapping(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, allow_unknown)
 61    
 62    # Build dynamics model
 63    dynamics_model = None
 64    try:
 65        phys = getattr(config, "physics", None)
 66        if phys is not None:
 67            if use_full:
 68                dynamics_model = FullDIPDynamics(phys)
 69            else:
 70                dynamics_model = DoubleInvertedPendulum(phys)
 71    except Exception as e:
 72        logger.debug(f"Could not build dynamics model: {e}")
 73        dynamics_model = None  # OK: Controller may not require dynamics
 74    
 75    # Get shared parameters
 76    try:
 77        sim_cfg = getattr(config, "simulation", None)
 78        sim_dt = getattr(sim_cfg, "dt", None) if sim_cfg is not None else None
 79    except Exception as e:
 80        logger.debug(f"Could not extract simulation dt parameter: {e}")
 81        sim_dt = None  # OK: Controller may have dt in its own config
 82    
 83    dt_in_cfg = "dt" in ctrl_cfg_dict
 84    mf_in_cfg = "max_force" in ctrl_cfg_dict
 85    
 86    if dt_in_cfg:
 87        shared_dt = float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("dt"))
 88    else:
 89        shared_dt = float(sim_dt if sim_dt is not None else 0.01)
 90        logger.warning(
 91            f"controllers.{key}: no 'dt' specified; inheriting dt={shared_dt} from simulation configuration."
 92        )
 93    
 94    if mf_in_cfg:
 95        shared_max_force = float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("max_force"))
 96    else:
 97        shared_max_force = 20.0
 98        logger.warning(
 99            f"controllers.{key}: no 'max_force' specified; using default max_force={shared_max_force}."
100        )
101    
102    _validate_shared_params(key, shared_dt, shared_max_force)
103    
104    # Delegate to specific controller construction
105    # This is the legacy if/elif chain from the original factory
106    # We keep it for backward compatibility
107    
108    if key == "classical_smc":
109        return _build_classical_smc(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, dynamics_model, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
110    elif key == "sta_smc":
111        return _build_sta_smc(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, dynamics_model, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
112    elif key == "adaptive_smc":
113        return _build_adaptive_smc(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
114    elif key == "swing_up_smc":
115        return _build_swing_up_smc(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, dynamics_model, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
116    elif key == "hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc":
117        return _build_hybrid_adaptive_sta_smc(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, dynamics_model, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
118    elif key == "mpc_controller":
119        return _build_mpc_controller(key, ctrl_cfg_dict, config, gains, shared_dt, shared_max_force, allow_unknown)
120    else:
121        raise FactoryConfigurationError(f"Controller '{ctrl_name}' is not a recognized type.")

 1def _build_classical_smc(key: str, ctrl_cfg_dict: Dict[str, Any], config: Any, gains: List[float], dynamics_model: Optional[Any], shared_dt: float, shared_max_force: float, allow_unknown: bool) -> Any:
 2    if ClassicalSMC is None:
 3        raise ImportError(
 4            "Controller 'classical_smc' is unavailable (import error). Ensure required modules are importable."
 5        )
 6    
 7    allowed = {
 8        "dt", "max_force", "damping_gain", "boundary_layer", 
 9        "switch_method", "regularization", "gains"
10    }
11    unknown_keys = set(ctrl_cfg_dict.keys()) - allowed
12    
13    if unknown_keys and not allow_unknown:
14        raise FactoryConfigurationError(
15            f"controllers.{key}: Unknown configuration keys: {', '.join(sorted(unknown_keys))}. "
16            f"Allowed keys: {', '.join(sorted(allowed))}"
17        )
18    
19    boundary_layer = float(ctrl_cfg_dict.get("boundary_layer", 0.01))
20    if boundary_layer <= 0:
21        raise ConfigValueError(f"controllers.{key}.boundary_layer must be > 0 (got {boundary_layer})")
22

32    gains_to_use = _get_default_gains(key, config, gains)
33    
34    instance = ClassicalSMC(
35        gains=gains_to_use,
36        dynamics_model=dynamics_model,
37        max_force=shared_max_force,
38        boundary_layer=boundary_layer,
39        regularization=regularization,
40        **({"switch_method": switch_method} if switch_method else {}),
41    )
42    
43    if allow_unknown and unknown_keys:
44        instance.unknown_params = {k: ctrl_cfg_dict[k] for k in unknown_keys}
45    
46    return instance
